title: Ticket #2292: schedd hangs on receiveing SIGSEGV
description:
Start up a schedd on Linux. "kill -11 $SCHEDDPID". (11 is SIGSEGV) Observe that you get a stack dump in the log file, as expected. But..

Expected behavior: schedd terminates with signal 11.

Observed behavior: schedd continues running, possibly hung. Sending signal 11 again causes the program to terminate as expected. If instead you send, say, signal 9, the program terminate with signal 9.

Relevant code is /src/condor_utils/dprintf_config.cpp around line 68 in sig_backtrace_handler(int signum).
remarks:
2011-Jul-13 14:09:27 by adesmet:
condor_master does not exhibit the same behavior. It terminates immediately upon getting signal 11.

2011-Jul-13 15:34:08 by adesmet:
I removed the call to dprintf_dump_stack. Code continues to malfunction (hang on receiving signal 11). After a few attempts at debugging with gdb, suddenly it works as expected. I re-add the call to dprintf_dump_stack. It still works. Whatever is going wrong appears to be subtle.

Either way, I'm tentatively ruling out dprintf_dump_stack as the culprit, as I have seen things work and not work both with and without it.
